text.title: Silvio Berlusconi backs Italy's coalition government in u-turn - video

main.head: Silvio Berlusconi backs Italy's coalition government in u-turn - video
main.p: This article is more than 11 years old

Silvio Berlusconi, leader of Italy's centre-right Freedom People (PdL) party, pledges to support the country's coalition government, despite having previously threatened to withdraw his MPs. The 77-year-old former prime minister, who was convicted of tax fraud in August, said his party would vote to support prime minister Enrico Letta's coalition. The u-turn came after senior PdL members refused to bring down the government at Berlusconi's behest
